title: Remove most references to `NetworkStore.getAuthToken()`

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem
There are a lot of action files that use `getAuthToken()` and then add the auth token manually to the API parameters (perfect example [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/4074a7cf3aeb778c4ceca6d278a8e46335a101fe/src/libs/actions/Card.ts#L456)). This is an anti-pattern because the auth token is already added to the proper API commands further down in the network library [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/4074a7cf3aeb778c4ceca6d278a8e46335a101fe/src/libs/Network/enhanceParameters.ts#L60).

# Solution
Find all the references to `getAuthToken()` that can be removed, remove them, and ensure that the API commands still work properly.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @brunovjk</details>

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.91-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2625/folder/13176744/41237166/1103225487 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Win 11/Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create new workspace, enable Distance rate 3. Click on Distance rate and click on Add rate 4. Add "New rate" is 1.00 / mile, "New rate 1" is 2.00 / mile 5. Disable Default rate 6. Navigate to workspace chat create the manual track distance with New rate 1 (2.00 / mile) 7. Create another manual track distance and proceed to the confirmation page observe the rate ## Expected Result: Rate field on confirm page should show the last selected rate, which is 2.00 / mile ## Actual Result: Rate field on confirm page shows the first enable rate in workspace setting instead of last selected rate ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e9306d75-7691-4f15-8aab-4d09a9fb3726 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Expense - One receipt in Confirm detail page when repeatedly adding multi single receipt

labels.name: External

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.90-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2595/folder/13177049/49475610/1101373286 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Win 11/Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Open a 1:1 DM chat 3. Click the "+" button near the Composer, then select Split expense (or select Create expense) 4. Choose to scan or upload a photo (the first receipt) 5. This should lead to the Confirm Details page 6. Click the Right-Hand Panel (RHP) back button to return to the split expense options 7. Select another photo (the second receipt) 8. Click Split expense (or Scan expense if step 3 selected Create expense) ## Expected Result: Verify that two receipts are now shown on the Confirm Details page, indicating that both have been added to the split ## Actual Result: Only one receipt is shown on the Confirm Details page. The same issue for create expense on 1:1 DM or workspace chat, there displays Create expense instead of Create 2 expenses ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/54e689b8-f1e2-46d3-b136-221074d53979 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.90-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/77040 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** starynight123@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.7.1/Pixel 8a/Android 16 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: Create new account which has self DM and no workspace 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to self DM & Create an expense 3. Go to Reports > Expenses 4. Select the expense via checkbox 5. Click dropdown menu > Move expense 6. Select Create report 7. Verify the upgrade message say "Reports are available on the Collect plan, starting at $5 per member per month." 8. Click on Upgrade button >> Confirm 9. Observe the upgrade message on animation RHP say "You've successfully upgraded S's Workspace to the Control plan! View your subscription for more details. ## Expected Result: On step 9 - Message on upgrade animation RHP should be relevant saying plan has been upgraded to Collect workspace as Reports feature is available on collect plan & does not require Control plan ## Actual Result: On step 7 message say reports are available on collect plan but after upgrading message on step 9 mentions that workspace has been upgraded to Control plan which is contradicting ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8fbc3927-0835-4d9f-bdc5-70b3038dda24 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
